greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Position of the first location of n in the decimal expansion of e.
comment: Except for a(0), the same as A051238.
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, e Digits
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Constant Digit Scanning
example: The first 7 is in the 2nd position of the digits of e, so a(7) = 2.
program: (PARI) trajedigitsd(n,m) = { default(realprecision,6000); p = exp(1)*10^5000; v = Vec(Str(p)); for(d=0,m, for(x=1,n, if(d<10, y = eval(v[x]), if(d<100, y = eval(v[x])*10 + eval(v[x+1]), if(d<1000, y = eval(v[x])*100 + eval(v[x+1])*10 + eval(v[x+2]), y = eval(v[x])*1000 + eval(v[x+1])*100 + eval(v[x+2])*10 + eval(v[x+3]) ); ); ); if(y == d,print1(x",");break); ); ) }
xref: Cf. A036900 (number of digits in the decimal expansion of e that must scanned to get all n-digit strings).
Cf. A032445 (positions in pi), A088577 (positions in phi).
results.author: _Cino Hilliard_, Nov 19 2003
